timeline.title: Microsoft Ignite: Day 2
timeline.text:
🚀 Day 2 at Microsoft Ignite! 🚀

Microsoft Intune is getting fantastic upgrades! With device inventory now available for all operating systems and new advanced analytics capabilities, we can query multiple devices using KQL and take remote actions based on real-time insights and anomalies. Truly impressive!

In Microsoft Entra, passkeys are now generally available, offering fast, easy, and phishing-resistant authentication. Plus, Universal Continuous Access Evaluation is here to revoke access in near real-time and tackle the risk of token replay attacks.

timeline.title: Microsoft Ignite: Day 1
timeline.text:
Day 1 at Microsoft Ignite 🔥

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella kicked off with an impressive keynote. Tons of great announcements, but above all, security is the top priority! This is clear with many new Purview announcements like Data Security Posture Management (DSPM). DSPM provides centralized visibility by integrating signals from MIP, IRM, and DLP. It offers actionable policy recommendations and supports continuous risk assessment with historical trends and insights.

Continuous Exposure Management looks incredibly promising—imagine Secure Score on steroids! Definitely worth exploring further.

Andy Meyfroidt and I wrapped up the day at a fantastic Microsoft party. Great meeting new people like Gregor Reimling, Eric Berg, and Sammy Deprez.

timeline.title: I released my open-source security framework!
timeline.text:
Just released my open-source framework: Conditional Access Blueprint! This framework includes 4 powerful tools, helping you to streamline the creation and validation of your organization's access policies and strategy.

🔒 2 Tools for Building Access Security:

  • Persona Flow Diagram: Define access restrictions and actions for each user role.
  • Persona Requirements: Translate your personas into Conditional Access policies with an Excel template.

🔍 2 Tools for Verifying Access Security:

  • Impact Matrix: Spot misconfigurations and review user impact changes.
  • Simulator: Simulate and validate your access policies in various scenarios, including malicious ones.

The Conditional Access Blueprint is now available for everyone to use and contribute to. Check it out and let me know your thoughts!

timeline.title: ❗New “Insider Risk” condition in Azure Conditional Access? ❗
timeline.text:
🔍While observing the network traffic in the Azure Portal, I stumbled upon an upcoming Conditional Access condition getting ready for Preview: Insider Risk! You will be able to scope your policies to 3 Insider Risk levels from Purview Adaptive Protection (preview): minor, moderate and elevated. Adaptive Protection uses machine learning to identify and mitigate the most critical risks with the most effective data loss prevention (DLP) protection controls dynamically.

🕑 As I already blogged about 1.5 years ago, a second new Conditional Access condition 'time restrictions' is in development, but we will probably have to wait a bit longer for them to become available.

Let's dive in and get a sneak peek into the exciting things that are on the horizon of Conditional Access!

These applications operate often without you noticing, and some of these might need a little extra security. Below post describes a method to spot these applications accessed from only 1 single IP according to logs!

But hey, a word of caution: while you want to keep your data and infrastructure safe, you also want to avoid blocking legitimate access cases. So, tread carefully! ⚠️

timeline.title: Deploy your organization’s private Copilot in just 30 minutes 🚀
timeline.text:
Guess what? Blocking A.I. sites like ChatGPT doesn't stop your users from finding other ways to chat it up with the machines. Some of these alternatives might even be sketchier when it comes to protecting your (sensitive) data. But don't worry, this post got your back! 👇

I've created up a simple guide that shows you how to create your very own private ChatGPT using Azure. No tech wizardry required – you can have it up and running in just 30 minutes! This setup makes sure your data takes a detour through a private AI model instance in Azure's OpenAI, so you're not sending your data through who-knows-where. Plus, authentication is provided with Entra. 🛡️

💰When it comes to costs, you may consider downsizing to an Azure CosmosDB Free Tier and utilizing a free/B1 Azure App Service.

Bing Enterprise (currently in preview) might also offer a solution. Here, prompt are send to Bing, but 'won't leak outside the organization'. Documentation is not clear about data processing outside of EU boundaries.

timeline.title: Time-based Conditional Access
timeline.text:
When opening a conditional access policy in the Azure Portal, the backend fetches the policy object through the https://main.iam.ad.ext.azure.com.mcas.ms/api API. This object contains all the configurations of this policy including policyname, users, client applications, all the conditions and the controls. This conditions have the following categories:

  • Client apps
  • Device platforms
  • Device state
  • locations
  • Sign-in risk
  • User risk
  • Time

The time object is not configurable in the Azure Portal, but is included in each policy. It seems like a feature in development where office-hours or time-ranges can be configured. This would not fully prevent an attack, but helps build your layered defense. Modifying the creating or editing request of this policy does not have any effect.

An example of this object, which is included in each policy, below:

...

{
    "time": {
        "all": 0,
        "included": {
            "type": 0,
            "timezoneId": null,
            "dateRange": {
                "startDateTime": "5/15/2022 12:00:00 AM",
                "endDateTime": "5/16/2022 12:00:00 AM"
            },
            "daysOfWeek": {
                "day": [
                    0,
                    1,
                    2,
                    3,
                    4,
                    5,
                    6
                ],
                "startTime": "5/15/2022 12:00:00 AM",
                "endTime": "5/16/2022 12:00:00 AM",
                "allDay": false
            },
            "isExcludeSet": false
        },
        "excluded": {
            "type": 0,
            "timezoneId": null,
            "dateRange": {
                "startDateTime": "5/15/2022 12:00:00 AM",
                "endDateTime": "5/16/2022 12:00:00 AM"
            },
            "daysOfWeek": {

}
